Comment: I question every day why is it legal for companies / judges / officials outside of a direct political career to have any political affiliation? Voting is private, you aren't allowed to decide what others should vote for so why is manipulating it to the point of almost no choice legal? Even at work I turn on my PC and MSN is posting political opinions as news.   I've been voting since I was 20 years old, every 2 years, and after almost 20 years of doing it I have to say I'm very disappointed in our choices, I only really vote Democrat because Republicans legitimately stand against the things I want, but Democrats are in no shape or form a representative of what I would like, nor have they been very useful to stop republicans, even when they win. I truly feel if we had better leaders to vote for, this "news" would never have even existed.
Author: RainbowIcee

Comment: >I've been voting since I was 20 years old, every 2 years,   You know that elections are held every year, right? One of the reasons we're in this mess is that people don't bother to vote in state and local elections and even fewer vote in primaries. Those are every bit as important as the Federal elections. Want better candidates? Vote in primaries and tell your friends to do the same.

Comment: To vote in preliminaries you have to join the party, I won't do such as I sadly don't believe neither have good intentions, I hold off on the chance some non R or D will rise and I'll support them. Which is my complaint, Dems don't do what people vote them for.   State elections (senators and representative) are every 2 years not every year.   Other elections are dependant on City, State and municipality, some don't happen for a long while such as Mayor or judges.   Where I live there aren't elections every year, that's either some odd coincidence or in the middle of too many political circumstances
